Reviews.Title: Nikon s1000pj vs. s1100pj
Reviews.Author: James P. Ltaestro "Pat Maestro"
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to see a camera with a built in projector and first saw the older S1000 on Amazon for half price of the newer s1100pj.I first bought the newer camera because it has a brighter Projector up to 14 lumis compared to up to 10 lumis of light projection on the older camera.I also liked the newer features such as Fisheye effect and 720p high difinition video recording.When amazon dropped the the price on the older camera s1000pj ($129.00) I decided to buy it and compare it to the newer version s1100pj and here are the results.The newer camera sucks at $309.00.First of all I had trouble getting the touch screen to respond when looking at my photos. The projector brightness doesn't look better then the older camera.The 3 inch view screen on the new camera remains on when projecting which is very annoying. The only way to shut off the viewer screen on the camera is when using the remote control.The fisheye effect is not fisheye at all. It's Nikon's way of adding a strange effect (Non-Adjustable) on photos already taken and cannot be used when shooting 16 X 9 photos or with Video recording.The older s1000pj is the only way to go.There's no touch screen which is better in my opinion and the Viewer screen on the camera automatically shuts off when using the projector.The brightness on the wall looks about the same as the newer camera's projector.The focus adjustment is a knob on the newer camera and a slider control on the older camera. Both are easy to use.Even the battery compartment on the older camera is more user friendly.I was having trouble removing the battery on the new camera as it would not drop out without the need of shaking the camera.Also, the description failed to mention that if you use the projector for a few minutes you must wait for the camera to cool for about 30 minutes before you can resume taking pictures so keep that in mind if you're at a party.The result is buy the older s1000pj Nikon camera. You will save money and have a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gadget for any geek
Reviews.Author: Pointdexter
Reviews.Content: I have owned Nikon SLRs and own a Nikon D-SLR and wanted a smaller camera to take on shorter business trips and into places where SLRs camera are not always convenient or allowed. I had seen the videos/promos for this camera and wanted this before it even came out. I ordered via OneCall (one of Amazon's partners) on the first day it was available and so far I'm impressed. The touch screen works really well, menus are very obvious, picture quality is very acceptable for a point-and-shoot, video quality is very nice, battery life is acceptable (I ordered a spare battery as I have a history of taking many photos) and of course there is the projector, which most of you want to know about. In daylight it works well on a 8x11 size background from 1 to 2 feet away. Anything further away or colored background are not ideal in daylight. In a darker to dark room, you can actually go quite big, much bigger compared to stated, with reasonable quality. Obviously, the closer to the wall, the better the quality, but remember that this is just a very small projector, and it's built into a camera and not a stand-alone device or intended to be a stand-alone projector. Battery life suffers quickly using the projector and I wish they would not display the "battery low" indicator on the projected image, but that's how it works.Drawing on images while projected does not work as smooth as in the promos and the provided stylus is a better tool for this compared to using your fingers.Have to yet test it as a projector on a PC but assume this to be similar compared to projecting images.Overall it lived up to my expectations. Nikon has a gem with this one, and after testing the S1000pj at a retail store, it seems like quite an improvement over last year's model. It's a good camera and for a geek like me, it's also a sweet gadget.

Reviews.Title: Amazon's GREAT, Nikon is NOT!!!!
Reviews.Author: SVMOJITO
Reviews.Content: Shortly after receiving this camera the shutter button/zoom switch became problematic.  I contacted Amazon and they replaced it, no questions asked.  Kudos to Amazon's excellent customer service.  The second camera developed the same problem after six months, obviously a design flaw.  Amazon then referred us to Nikon customer service and gave us a $30 gift certificate for our troubles.  Since then, dealing with Nikon's customer service has been a nightmare for an obviously flawed product.  The denied any fault and said Amazon probably dropped the boxes the cameras were stored in and have insisted that we pay $84.00 to repair the camera.  They also refused to allow us to speak to a manager or some higher authority.  Feeling like we had not other choice, we agreed to pay the $84.00 to repair this $300+ camera.  That was four months ago, they have not received the part for the repair as yet and we are without a camera.  It remains to be seen when and how this will be resolved.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA and Nikon obviously does not value it customers as evidenced by its very POOR customer service.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a camera + projector for the price
Reviews.Author: iPod Touch
Reviews.Content: The projector is 14 lumens but is not as powerful or as big a pk102 which is 11 lumens. Connecting it to a PC requires installing a software using a CD they provide. The projection lags a lot on a netbook. You have to switch the settings of the camera every time you want to change from uploading photos to computer and using the computer as a projector. The whole camera is pretty big in size compared to regular digital cameras but can't complain on a device with a built-in projector. The camera has some pretty nice features, though some requires the user manual to help you find out what they do. The flash is very powerful and there is a touch to focus/exposure on taking pictures. Not on video though, unfortunately. The touch screen sometimes lags a little and requires more pressure than smartphones such as the iPhone. Overall, not bad.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.... has some minor flaws.
Reviews.Author: Nathanael Blais "Zoloe"
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is not as sensitive as I would like it to be without using the stylus. Whenever I'm trying to change settings or go to the next picture, it doesn't wan't to respond when I try to move it accross the screen... unless I press harder than normal. Maybe I'm just too used to the iPod Touches screen.The projector is very nice, but it has to be pretty dark to be "very nice". It's really nice to be able to show off your pictures or videos on up to a 47" screen instead of everyone huddling around you and the tiny camera screen right after you took a picture or something. Overall, this is a very worthy camera and I highly recommend it. Picture quality is great and it takes 720p High Definition video. Also, the sound quality is pretty good as well. If I could, I'd give this camera a 4 1/2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Not one of Nikons best products.
Reviews.Author: Barinr
Reviews.Content: I own several Nikon cameras including some very high end ones. I purchased this so I could give an older digital pocket camera to my daughter. She got the best part of the deal. Her 8 MP older Nikon takes better pictures. This camera often over exposes, ESP with flash. Nikon no longer includes a manual. It must be downloaded from the Internet. On 8x10 paper from your printer. Not the easiest way to get solutions and forget conveniently carrying the manual. As I use this camera further the less I think of it. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Conner "mecxe9"
Reviews.Content: Bought as a replacement for an older Coolpix camera and I love it.  Large touch screen monitor/viewfinder and the ability to project your photos is a nice touch.  Battery lasts a long time as well plus the panorama feature is lots of fun.  At 14 MP the photo quality is unbeatable and having HD video a plus.  Get a large capacity SD disk and you are set.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S1100pj
Reviews.Author: mar
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures and is easy to use. The built-in-projector has much to be desired. When viewing you think your pictures are dark and not clear I suppose for a quick peak it wouldn't be bad but I expected better.

Reviews.Title: S1100 PJ Nikon
Reviews.Author: D. Bush "MstrMstr"
Reviews.Content: Let me say this- Mines for sale- By the time you get thru the screen menu you have lost the shot .. when you do get a pic its flat and washed out..I've never been so hornswagled by ads like this before- The projector is just plain horrible and marginal in total darkness on a flat white wall from 3 feet.Dont waste your temper,time or money..

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Mhroadkng
Reviews.Content: Pros: many exposure preset options. More advanced than basic point and shoot camera. Relatively small and portable. The projector is easy to use. After learning to navigate through the options it becomes relatively easy to use.Cons:a new system of selecting features takes some tIme. Lumens (brightness) for projector is a little weak but acceptable for something so small.

Reviews.Title: So glad I was able to get a refund.
Reviews.Author: S. Marks
Reviews.Content: The novelty of the built-in projector is what attracted me to this camera.  As a woodcarver, it is useful to have some way to project an image for tracing onto a block of wood, and I expected to use this camera for that purpose.  I also anticipated selling my Panasonic Lumix 6MP camera and Aiptek Action HD GVS camcorder on eBay, because I figured that I wouldn't need them anymore if I had the Coolpix, with its triple threat of camera, camcorder and projector.  Wrong!  Despite a higher pixel format, the Coolpix still shots failed to capture the same richness and detail as my Lumix.  And, you have to wait an unacceptable amount of time until the Coolpix is ready to take its next still shot!  The HD camcorder was really fuzzy on panorama-type shots, and even when set to continuous auto-focus, it failed to focus on the subject when I zoomed in.  That was really surprising and I considered the relatively poor video function as a dealbreaker. Image color balance with both camera and camcorder were also too blue/cool for my taste.  I could have gotten along just fine with the built-in projector, but the other Coolpix components made me reject this camera.  I've never owned a Nikon before...they were too expensive, but I'd always wanted one.  I'm over that now.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth It
Reviews.Author: Lynn Araneta
Reviews.Content: I purchase a digital camera every 2 years.  I was attracted to this camera because of its built-in projector.  I figured that it would be a great way to share my photos while amongst friends or family...and since it was a Nikon 14MP camera, I took for granted that it would display better quality pictures than my Casio Exilim 10MP.  I was wrong. The pictures are not as sharp as my 10MP Casio, and the exposure is pretty erratic.  In addition, it has the worst shot-to-shot performance than my previous cameras (Sony, Canon, Casio), which is quite an embarrasment when taking group photos.  I usually take 2 or 3 shots of a group to be able to choose the best outcome, but having to make the subjects wait for about 10 seconds in between photos is absurd (that's a long time to freeze their smiles and keep their eyes from blinking).  I've used the built in projector when the camera was new, impressing those who would see it, however, since I have now lost confidence in the quality of photos, I don't even use it anymore.  With these disappointing results I cannot wait for 2 more years to purchase my next camera...and it certainly won't be a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with Nikon
Reviews.Author: SweetPacino
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I was pretty excited to snag this camera for $130.  The Nikon brand has a good rep and I had read some good reviews on the camera.I couldn't get the camera to take a decent picture.  I tried many settings on the camera as well as many different environments.  Most of the pictures came out blurry, had horrible red-eye (that was unfixable with basic software), and under/over-exposed.The lens on the camera does not move in and out on the camera, and I wonder if that is what is causing the focusing problem, or maybe I had a defective one (which could explain the cheap price from Amazon?).  Nonetheless, I still didn't think it worth the $130 I paid for it.  I have an old Canon Powershot that takes pictures far superior to this one.I like that you can zoom in and out during video, but the zoom is not smooth and has a bit of a learning curve to learn the increments.The projector is a cool feature, and works OK, but it has to be pretty dark to use it.If you are on the fence about this one, choose another. I know it is not worth the $350 they are selling it for now.

Reviews.Title: One of the worst cameras made by Nikon
Reviews.Author: Y. Isik "Bortar"
Reviews.Content: Cheap...Cheap....CheapEasily broken plastic parts. Worst customer service ever ! Over 2 monts, still waiting for cheap spare parts that will probably break again right away.Unless you take pleasure from being frustrated, buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Cool projector bur ended up returning
Reviews.Author: R. Jaco
Reviews.Content: The projector feature was really neat on this camera, and the camera looks really cool too.  But the touch screen was so slow, and the flash either wouldn't go off in low light (resulting in blurry pictures) or the flash would go off but was so bright it would ruin the picture.  I love Nikon's SLR cameras but thought this compact was not the best for the price.

Reviews.Title: Different (from the other two in this series) each are very unique
Reviews.Author: M. Gehret "G-Man  Colorado"
Reviews.Content: Nikon created 3 very different projector cameras in this Series. The initial launch was the S1000pj which is impressive. Built (most solid) However, It didn't offer the larger screen which are 3 inch. But Nikon's first launch is well throught out, nicely designed, rugid and a winner. The Second model, S1100pj had many changes/improvements from the first. And, the final projection camera (S1200pj)...is stellar.  The S1100pj is the ONLY one which offers touch screen menus, a round dial for focusing, (with activation inside of the focus dial). Not so impressive is the SD Card/Battery compartment hinge ..which is flimsy and feels as if it could break. On the plus side, the touch screen is nice, but users will need to read how to erase or trash shots they don't want to keep. Set-up (via touch screen) is fairly well laid out..gives the user many choices and features. The zoom (while shooting in video mode) is really smooth and very nice. The power useage for this particular model, is fairly rapid ..so users will need 2 or 3 batteries for back-up. This model includes the remote control when projecting and a great idea. The Sound Quality is SUPERB. Infact, all 3 models provide the VERY BEST SOUND (of ANY compact camera). The built in speaker allows users to actually increase or decrease sound . I was amazed with its clearity and loudness for such a small digital.Bottom Line....I am on the fence with this model, when Nikon's final model (in this series) the S1200pj truly is The VERY BEST . They both offer a "fill light" when shooting in video mode, and both later models offer a Video button for quick capture in video mode.The S1200pj continued with great sound, a fill light for videos, a projector dust cover which also activates the projector.  It's much brighter DLP projector allows users to project to 60 inches and has a built-in bottom stand.Each of the Nikon projection cameras are different yet impressive. It comes down to an individuals particular taste. I really like each for their unique and different designs and features. I would give 5 STARS to the final model (S1200pj) and this model - 3 1/2 Stars.  Regardless of model..the user and their audience will be impressed. Video playback projections are its strong hold. Others bought these cameras for using the projector for their cellphone or laptop.  Good going Nikon !

Reviews.Title: Waste Of Money Less Than ONE Star!!
Reviews.Author: Kym
Reviews.Content: My experience of this Nikon was been a disaster of epic proportions..  I purchased the camera was to utilize the projection feature via usb from pc photos/clip art but FAIL!!!On a perfectly smooth flat white surface the image is fuzzy, dark, colour and shape of the projected image is highly distorted, and forget the 'focus', there is no focusing the photos to be usable.The camera makes a whirring sound I assume that is the mechanics of the projector as none of my numerous digital cameras made such a noise.I purchased this camera about 3 months ago, have used it no more than 3 hrs. tops all of which was trying to get it to work as Nikon described it does with zero percent success.  It has been nothing but intense frustration, headache and sure as heck did not live up to ANY expectation I had.I am sending it back. I would not take another one of these cameras if it were offered, I would run away from it as fast as possible.  I have ordered aprox. 40 items from Amazon but hands down, this is the only worthless piece of junk I have ever received.  If I could give less than a zero, I would.  Nothing more than a waste of a lot of money ! For me, a rotten experience all the way around!

Reviews.Title: projector is not that bright
Reviews.Author: vibgyor
Reviews.Content: camera quality and built is good. but prokector light is not bright . dat time forget it. in dark room its not bad. over all i can give 4 stars. doing its job as its expected.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: ramon felix
Reviews.Content: great quality pictures and the best: the image proyected into my wall! not great image like a professional proyector but works perfectly when traveling to show my videos and pictures to my family. just love it

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a camera the will work in the cold, underwater, and wants a little dependability. It takes great pictures too!

Reviews.Title: Needs a better brochure
Reviews.Author: John Grychak
Reviews.Content: The camera is not easy to use right off, the manual doesn't go into enough detail. Without a memory card forget it, the camera virtually has no memory, other than these little flaws, the Camera itself takes great pctures/movies.

Reviews.Title: Unique camera - great price
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Russell
Reviews.Content: I have a lot of cameras but the fact that this had a projector just drew me in.  It is very handy, small, and has lots of great features including that projector.  Excellent price!

Reviews.Title: Sounds good on paper...
Reviews.Author: pma
Reviews.Content: I actually bought this camera online at Best Buy during one of their Cyber Monday/Black Friday deals for $140. For the price, the camera isn't too bad (not to mention it's a Nikon). First and foremost, I even admitted to my friends that the projector feature sounds really cool, but in reality, I have not and cannot think of an occasion where I think I would be able to use it for a purpose other than to say "my camera has a projector". The projector itself is pretty good quality if the background you are shooting on is flat with dim lighting.The camera itself is just ok... I bought the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20K 14.1 MP Digital Camera ([...]) last year and it is a MUCH better camera as far as quality and ease of use. I don't have a problem with the touch screen on the Nikon, but the scene settings (for lighting) are very limited. It takes decent pictures in the dark but overall, the quality of any picture I take seems to be a bit blurry compared to the very crisp quality from the Panasonic camera.The zoom function is my biggest gripe of this camera: it's one of those dials that you control on the top of the camera to zoom in and out, but rather than a smooth zoom, it zooms in increments, so it's very hard to get customized control. As I said before, the quality of the picture is severely compromised when zooming in (even before you hit the digital zoom).Overall, if you can get this camera for a good price, go for it, but if you're looking for a more long-term digital camera, I would go with something else.

Reviews.Title: Lots to learn
Reviews.Author: C. Maxson
Reviews.Content: I have had Nikon cameras for 25 years.  I am an interior designer and thought the additional projection feature would be of value in my business.So far, I have found the camera easy to use if you don't want to get too technical.  I have not mastered all the on screen touch features.  My major problem is that the on screen touch features are hard to get to work.  The photo preview is difficult to get going with two fingers.  It just isn't responsive enough perhaps because I am used to iPhone and iPad.  The bigger screen for preview and cropping in the camera is an improvement for me.  I will have to work harder on all the options available to set up sort images for projection.I like the zoom feature and the focusing hints and clues.  I do like the auto settings because with my old Coolpix I had to remember to manually set the close up or portrait setting and then I would forget to reset it.  I had a few issues with downloading and the battery seems to run down quickly.  There is no warning or at least I haven't seen one.Love the purple color.  Overall......an upgrade for me and I am sure I will soon be as comfortable with this camera as I was with my last one.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use advanced camera
Reviews.Author: TravellerJack
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use however the cd-rom that contains the user manual is very important to go through before using the product.I found out there are so many shooting options with this camera but like most digitals, there is a "dummy" mode which really works great and adapts to most shots!I hadn't replaced my digital in so long but this camera is a major upgrade and I am so glad I decided on this one!This isn't the smallest of cameras but I really like the look and the abilities of the camera itself. Plus it's lime green, who can complain about that!The rechargable battery that accompanies this camera lasted longer than I expected too. I used it for about 2 1/2-3 days before having to recharge.I absolutely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Be the Life of the Party
Reviews.Author: Scully0007 "K. Holmes"
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my 20-year old son for Christmas. I was a bit concerned because of the mixed reviews. Fear not, he's very happy. He was the life of the party at the Christmas parties using the projector feature to show of the photos to lots of laughs. He even called me from his girlfriends Christmas dinner and asked if I could order one for her sister. (To her dismay prices had risen quite a bit.) He drove over 800 miles on a road trip this past weekend and used it without incident.We have a DSLR so our familiy is used to both point and shoot and fancier digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Backlight issues and Where's the manual?
Reviews.Author: Leslye M Schneier
Reviews.Content: We had some problems seeing any image on the touch screen when taking a picture in bright light. Can't find a way to correct that. And where is the manual? is it on the disks or a no show. The quick guide is basically useless to understand the camera.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: D. Brooks
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera I've spent more than $100 on, so I haven't used tons of cameras at this price range. The touch screen is really touchy you need to press down really hard for it to work. The pictures are good, just a tad shaky sometimes. The video quality is great and that's probably the main reason I got this. So you might be able to find a little better camera for the price, but this is still good.

Reviews.Title: an interesting camera...
Reviews.Author: maxreyno
Reviews.Content: this camera just make he proposit, it amaze the people that doesnt know that kind of technology, but the touchscreen is the one who needs the stylus to work right

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: J. Felt
Reviews.Content: Unless you're in a cave the projector is worthless. For the money there are better cameras out there. I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: My personal Projector
Reviews.Author: Mukthiar Gani "Gani"
Reviews.Content: This tiny creation of Nikon is awesome.Currently the most distinct camera in the market.The projector is super cool and the camera features are amazing.To cut the story short, A fantastic gadget.

Reviews.Title: Tags: Nikon, Projector, Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Cee
Reviews.Content: It's a decent price for a Nikon,12.1MP,5x and built-in PROJECTOR camera. Even the projector seems like very necessary and makes the size not that attracted to girls, but it's indeed  a surprise to me.

ProductInfo.Features:
Incredible built-in projector; 14.1-megapixel CCD sensor
5x wide-angle optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens
3-inch touch-screen display;  5-way VR Image Stabilization system
HD (720p)movie recording with One-Touch control button
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory card (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix S1100pj 14 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3-Inch LCD and Built-in Projector (Green)
